They have a great happy hour and decent beer collection, and some typical bar fare.We easily spend all day climbing here on different routes and still want to go back for more. The tall walls offer great endurance training, especially when you go up and down a few times in a row. I sweat my hardest climbing here. :) Or wait, no, I glow. ;) If you follow them on Instagram they'll know your name and be able to check you in more quickly when you enter, too, if you're lucky. Hi Vic!

I should write a review for this place because I go here at least 4 times a week. You could call me a gym rat I guess but I love climbing so much.  This place is amazing. The route setting is fun and challenging no matter what level of climber you are. I'm more of a rope climber so this place is perfect for what I need from a gym. I climb around the 5.11+ range and they feel like the ratings of real outdoor 5.11's. I take the yoga classes on Wednesday and Fridays and it is awesome. Also the gym area upstairs is great for training and cardio.  The bouldering area is not the best but it is good enough for me. The route setting is a little weird sometimes but they reflect the actual grades of bouldering outdoors.

My first time climbing and won't be my last!Came to Stronghold for a friend's birthday bash.. it was about a dozen of us, and the staff were SO helpful and attentive. The women's restroom on the first floor had two shower stalls and a bunch of lockers. The loft-like second floor has a small gym and studio for classes, and can also be curtained off to host private parties.Overall, it was fun and I would love to return.

This place is amazing! I tried climbing at another gym in Orange County, but wanted to go to a climbing gym in the L.A. area. Luckily, I found a Groupon deal for an introduction to rock climbing class! Yes! The teacher was great and the staff is amazing. They look like they enjoy being at work.A few days after taking the class I got a membership here, which is a pretty good deal. Membership includes a pass to the fitness center upstairs, yoga/fitness classes, free rentals and a free buddy pass (per calendar month).I only have one recommendation for the managers at Stronghold - please please please make sanitization wipes more available in the fitness area. Last time I went you guys ran out.

My daughter asked to have her birthday party at a climbing gym, and we chose Stronghold because it was the closest. So glad we did. They were great from start to finish. Kate in particular was really helpful, and great with the kids (all age 7). The upstairs party space is simple, but gives the parents a nice place to hang out and watch the kids while they climb. Their ipad sign-in makes the release forms super easy. All in all it was very laid back and the kids had a blast. Highly recommended.
A little pricey for me. I've never been rock climbing and they kind of just throw you into the wild if it's your first time. But in the end I had a great time!! Will be back!!
Tons of space for climbing, bouldering, and a gym. Four auto belays which is nice too if you don't have a friend to go with! I will be coming back!

This place rules. Came here with a friend- was a bit intimidated as I have a slight fear of heights...but damn once you're in the zone it's hard to focus on anything except trying to get to the top. Very safe and everyone who goes is down-to-earth. Will definitely come back! Just gotta work on my core and strengthening my hands/arms...the burn hurt was insane...I have a feeling I'll be sore tomorrow!

Bouldering is a really relaxing and meditative activity for me so I was keen to find my inner zen with my bf at, Stronghold, one of the newest climbing gyms in East LA.  First off, the location is beautiful. I love that the climbing gym is in a repurposed brewery. The exposed scaffolding and brick walls are a gorgeous backdrop to the climbing walls and there is a really hipster juxtaposition going on here. It's almost like this climbing facility belongs in the arts district and not Lincoln Heights! With that being said, we came on a Sunday around noon and parking was not difficult. It should be noted that all Stronghold gym members should park on Ave 21, before the gate. Once we entered the gym, we signed a waiver on the iPad minis by the entrance and were charged $20 a person for an all-day pass with $4.00 shoe, harness and chalk bag rentals. We started with the bouldering first and it was a disappointing and underwhelming experience. I've bouldered at ARC in Arcadia, CA before and found their walls to be higher and have significantly more routes. I wish Stronghold had more V0 and VB routes to select from because I did not see too many. From what I observed, it was easy for many people to top-out as the walls aren't too high (around 16 feet). My bf and I also decided to try the auto belays and he loved it! It's awesome that our day passes included the auto belays as this was my first time using one. As more people entered the gym, I noticed a lot of them were belaying. If you're into belaying, then I think Stronghold is an excellent climbing gym for you. There were so many high walls and a variety of difficulty in the routes for belaying! The 2nd floor overlooks all the climbing action and has a small fitness area complete with: a treadmill, a weight section and an area for yoga. This was a welcome escape for my hands and arms as I decided to take a break from the climbing and focus on running for a bit. Bottom line: Since this is a new gym, everything is still brand spankin' new--including the restrooms and lockers! I was amazed at how large and clean the bathrooms were. The lockers in the women's restroom were also self-locking so I felt my belongings were very secure while I climbed. For me, I think I would rate the gym 3 stars overall because of the bouldering walls. For future improvements, I would LOVE to see an expanded bouldering section with higher walls. My sore forearms and arms will surely thank you!

Is heres every employer is so nice. Kind and profesional.So. Really really exiting. Already I bring 6person at here. Cuz super super exiting~~~When I begining. I go weekly 1 or 2time. But nowI go allmost everyday! If I have time for climbingI go everyday! Im recomend u do it! It so good!

This place is like my second home! I became a member when it first opened and haven't looked back! here are some tips for newcomers:- If you're new to climbing and don't have any experienced friends to take you, definitely get an intro to rock climbing class from groupon. Otherwise you'll only be able to boulder (short walls, no rope) or use the 3 autobelays in the roped area. - If you buy a day pass that includes access to everything in the gym, so you can also try out a yoga or core class to get your money's worth! - Don't hesitate to ask staff members for help or advice. They are awesome! Super nice, caring people. - If you've climbed elsewhere, you still need to take a belay test for top-roping, and lead test for lead climbing but they are pretty straightforward. If you haven't climbed in awhile, ask a staff member to give you a quick review.- Head to Barbara's brewery next door for a post-climb beer and food -Plenty of parking in the long driveway except for weekday nights, when it can get crowded. Just drive past the building and park in the lots behind it. - Free wifi- Membership is kinda expensive, but it's worth it because I go several times a week and can't imagine life without it!

As a recently graduate from grad school, I don't have the money to join yet. So I've been here only with friends' guest passes. But the past few times I've been here, I've had a GREAT times. In fact, I went there just this past Saturday. The facility was still clean, routes were new and fresh, and most importantly, the staff members were still super duper friendly. Side note: they are always on Instagram showing supports to climbers. Personally, it makes me feel like a part of a big family. I pray that SH will keep up the work. I'm certain that I will be a member once I secure a job hehe :)

We came here a couple weeks ago for a belated birthday celebration. I'm not an avid climber so I was happy that they had two auto-belays in the gym. The staff was so very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, my husband twisted his ankle on a climb, but they were very helpful to provide ice, an ACE bandage wrap, and send us home with crutches even! I just found them to be over and beyond helpful and kind to us.A couple friends and I kept climbing and I love the very tall walls/ceilings and great natural light this gym has. A couple larger bouldering walls greet you in the entrance and then further back there are plenty of ropes for rock climbing and belaying. I hope to come back soon. The sign-in process was a bit of a drag as you have to fill out a lot of personal information and a waiver pre-climb. Probably not that much more than any other gym, but it would be great if they could someone speed that process up. The spot downtown is where the old Brewery used to be, parking is pretty reliable, but it would be better if there was a sign outside letting climbers know where the safe parking spots are. We had to come in and out to check the sign inside the gym and re-park our cars. Thankfully, parking is free.
Love this place. The staff are very friendly. Lots of options if you want to boulder or rope climb, and they even have a few self belay ropes if you don't have a climbing partner.

I took the lead climbing class with Bryan last Sunday and it was great!!I took the class because I took a lead climbing class at another climbing gym and it was a less than desirable experience. The class was big (11 people) but it didn't actually matter. Plenty of personalized attention, great information, he made sure to watch all of our falls. Emphasis on safety. Also love the gym itself. The walls are high, almost all the walls are top rope and lead accessible and the route setting is great. Bouldering section is great too. They just need air conditioning.

I love this gym! The staff was very friendly. There is a nice bouldering area that features top out routes as well as some roof climbing which is nice. I haven't been on the ropes yet but there is an impressive amount of routes for those who want to do top rope or sport. I also saw some sweet looking crack climbs. The gym also offers a decent weight lifting area with tread mills and rowing machines. I was very happy with my first visit and became a member!

I went there yesterday and enjoyed it very much. The location is easy to find with lots of parking space.  Staff is very friendly and attentive and for new comers explain everything and make them feel welcome. There are lots walls to climb so you don't feel you are on anybody's way. The bathroom and changing room is clean and neat. There is a $20 entrance fee and $5 rental fee which is pretty reasonable. And you can stay there as long as they are open which means you can go have lunch or dinner near the gym and come back and climb again. Can't wait to go back.

Overall, a very clean and safe gym with a vibrant climbing community. Excellent instructors and friendly owners. Good classes, although I find the material is covered a little too quickly for total beginners.My only gripes with the Stronghold are the high day-pass price ($20?!) and the attitudes of a few employees (in particular, I find Mikey consistently rude to men and overly friendly to women).

This was my first time here, came here with my daughter and her friend (age 10 & 9) and they really enjoyed it.  We used their auto belaying system as you need training to be able to belay someone.  The staff is friendly, the facility is bright and clean and they had 5 stations for auto belaying which was enough to keep us busy for a couple of hours.  We paid the day fee and were able to leave and come back throughout the day.  Would definitely look into getting trained in belaying.

Wish I could climb outdoors all the time.  Working full time as a desk jockey though, being a member at Stronghold is the next best thing for an after work climbing fix.  This place gets so many things right for a lead climbing gym.  46 foot walls, well though out space, quality route-setting, and frequent changing of routes to keep things fresh.  The weight training and machine areas are really good and not an afterthought like some other climbing gyms.  The staff and vibe here are friendly and people generally look out for each other.  Climbing grades here feel fairly accurate compared to outdoor sport grades at local areas.
This place is just amazing!! All of the staff are super kind and helpful. Jess was so helpful when I first got into climbing, and she is such an awesome teacher!
This. Place. Is. Awesome. Went last Saturday and attended the Intro to Climbing class. Highly recommend this place and will be coming back soon.

I love this place!! I've been a member for a while now and I love that they change their routes a lot. nice staff members, fun atmosphere...i've been asked multiple times by staff on my way out, "did you have fun?" and my answer is always a resounding yes :)

Both my boyfriend and I came back because the Stronghold location is very convenient, there is free parking on the street, and the facilities are new and clean.  This time around I had a better experience.  Brian kindly reviewed the ropes and belaying with us and my two friends.  Brian was super patient and kind.  The gym was pretty empty because it was fourth of July weekend.  I left on a positive note.  I left my sunglasses in a locker last time I was here, and it was in the lost and found.  If you go, I recommend going when it isn't busy for beginners.
Took my nephew and my niece to that place and it was overwhelming!  We loved it! The kids had so much fun and we will definitely be back!

Came to this gym a few weeks ago with the pass from a friend. Was glad to find a nice gym that was well ventilated! (compared to the hangar 18 gym I usually go to). Half of the gym is bouldering, and the other half is top rope (with some auto belays). The route ratings are pretty fair, and I like that the wall were tacky enough for me to climb on.  The top rope section has super high walls- great for endurance climbing.Not sure if there's a student discount, but if there is, I'd definitely come more often.

Best time to beat the crowd for you nine to fivers? That would be weekends when the gym opens. I highly recommend taking the class to learn how to top-rope. It was incredibly helpful and has us hooked on a new sport.

I usually climb at Sender One but ventured north to meet a buddy who was visiting friends in the area from out of town.  I'd also been wanting to check out Stronghold.  First, this is a solid gym, I'd probably say 4.5 stars, which is darn good.  Staff was very friendly and professional.  I was able to do the waiver and belay check in quick order.  The setting was very good for the most part.  I also liked that the grades weren't too soft.  I love my home gym, Sender, but the grades a bit generous at times.  Routes were plenty long and had nice movement.It was also clean and well-lit.  Some gyms are just dingy and dark.  Even better, there is a microbrewery around the corner!I'd certainly climb here periodically for a change-up. My only minor issue was parking.  Great job y'all-thanks for the hospitality!Update:  I went this weekend again and like the gym even more.  The route setting is great and more true to outside, although no gym can replicate what it feels like to be on a JTree 5.8 and thinking "WTF!!!!!  This is a 5.8?!"  And wondering where your next piece is....I like it so much I got a punch pass even though I am am member at Sender One, which is also a super solid gym with a great staff.  It's good to change it up be is you get used to a "style" and your home gym and even start to remember how individual holds feel. My only issue with Sender is not a complaint really, but a sign they're doing stuff right.  It's a freaking zoo sometimes.  The route setting at Sender is superb, as is Stronghold, but Sender assigns ratings that are too soft IMO.  Most gym staffs by far will tell you that this is a marketing issue in that it encourages new climbers rather than discouraging them.  The concern here is that so many people are new to the sport and transitioning outside quickly without the long mentoring process of the past.  They are mistake prone and much more likely to get in a jam.  they climb hard in a gym and think it equates to outside.  Outside is DIFFERENT.  And DANGEROUS.  They often will have large groups at the crag--this isn't a good idea new folks.  Just don't do it.  It makes communication harder and monopolizes moderate routes.So, for Stronghold, Kudos!  Great staff too.  The crew on 3/26/16 was helpful, cool, professional, friendly.

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW: the golden standard for climbing gyms. $20 for a day pass, $25 for pass and gear, $75 init. + $75/mo for membership with a guest pass once a month. Park on the street, not behind the gate. Make friends or you will not have a great time. Every 4 star review is from a newbie who does not know how good they have it. The staff at stronghold are the most knowledgeable and caring people I've ever met through the climbing community.The routes are challenging and varied, with stemmy routes, pumpy routes, balancey routes, tall routes, short routes, roof routes, one route two routs red routes blue routes. starts at 5.6 and ends at 5.14+. Bouldering is geared towards medium experienced people, but there are a handful of beginner routes.Memberships are expensive, but you get what you pay for. With freeweights upstairs, its easily worth it. Upstairs has a powerlifting cage, with one barbell and two fat/axle bars (strongmen stand up). they need one or two more barbells but that's okay. The wait is a bit long depending on who's working, do what you want. Apparently yoga is great but i'm not into that stuff. Its a privilege to climb here. Reward caring business owners and keep the dream alive by getting a membership and climb often!

I haven't been to EVERY climbing gym in Greater LA but I've been to more than a few and this is by far the best. The routesetting is high quality, the facilities are great - the people who work here are super cool. They have 3 cracks and a superbitchin lead arch which is generally way too pumpy for me unless they put up a moderately easy-ish route in there... But they have everything for everyone - from the badass to total beginner. I notice most of the 4 star reviews are from newer folk who like some reviewer ahead of me wrote "don't know how good they have it", just go here and support an awesome Independent climbing gym and don't complain about "not enough V0s" or whatever. You'll be better than that after coming here a couple more times anyway.

Been here many times and its always been great. With that said... an ASSociate "Mikey" made our group feel uncomfortable.  He approached us on a lead climb and didn't mention he worked at the gym. He criticized our techniques with attitude to a point that did not make us feel welcomed. His approach ruined our climb, night, and most importantly our outlook on the way the gym is overall handled by the associates. Hopefully our next experience is better.

I've been a member since October 2014. I used to be a member of Rockreation when I lived on the Westside, and have been to the LA.B, both in LA, but have also tried world class gyms in other cities. In general I find the gym acceptable and comfortable, and am content here. WHAT I LIKE: 1. They change their routes regularly and often... they have good route setters.2. Friendly staff3. Sufficient gym upstairs4. The music is never too offensive or obnoxious.5. Locker room has locks and plenty of lockers. 6. Plenty of parking.7. Members get to bring a guest for free each month.WHAT I WISH THEY WOULD CHANGE (in case management is reading): 1. Every gym I've been to has a family membership. They should too if they want to stay competitive. The second another nearby gym opens with family membership, I'll switch. Paying 2 initiation fees and individual fees/month for me and my husband? That is comparatively way more $$ than other gyms. 2. Their intro to climbing class is NOT UP TO PAR. I took it after taking Rockreation's so could directly compare. The owner spent 30 entire minutes talking about the history of climbing - which is not necessary for this type of class. He could have at least let us sit during that portion, but instead we stood the entire time and kept thinking it was about to be over. For brand new beginners who need to take a belay/intro class, the best use of time is making sure they know how to safely handle climbing equipment.  He needs an assistant. I repeatedly saw (and continue to when I am climbing) people in his intro class make really BAD, DANGEROUS MISTAKES. I sincerely feel he doesn't teach climbers how to belay properly considering the class is 3 hours. 3. It could definitely be cleaner.  All climbing gyms get covered in chalk, but I've been to gyms that are 30 years old, and if you don't attempt to clean it regularly, it gets worse and more disgusting.4. They don't have enough female employees there, thus the women's bathroom is consistently out of soap and/or paper towels.

I've been going here for 9 months now and it just continues to get better. There have been numerous improvements throughout the gym, which shows how the owner(s) value our feedback and want to provide the best climbing/training/yoga/work out experience possible. Problems change out every 4 weeks and they are always fun and challenging. There are various community events throughout the month as well. Parking can be difficult at times - usually during evening yoga classes. Membership prices are extremely fair, considering all you have access to: unlimited yoga, olympic weights + other high-quality equipment, a robust climbing-specific training area, and of course bouldering and roped climbing. Overall, a great addition to the neighborhood.

This is my favorite gym in L.A. It gets a bit warm in the summer but the walls are tall, the staff are awesome and the setting is sweet. Even when it's warm its still an awesome gym and you'll definitely get strong. They're in a cool spot with a good vibe and the local community is really welcoming and friendly. I highly recommend the youth team if you have kids, the coach is awesome. :D

This place rocks. Helpful staff, fun routes, killer location, awesome vintage building, beautiful people, workout equipment, yoga room...what else could one want? Can't recommend this place enough--getting my membership was the best decision of the year.

I learned how to lead climb here.  The owner of the gym taught the class.  Just yesterday I lead climbed my first Rockreation 5.10b thanks to Stronghold.  I believe the owners name is Peter.  Great class and their setting is amazing and fun for endurance building (huge walls).  If I lived on the east side I would be a regular at this gym.

This review is mainly for the introduction to climbing class! Positives - Our instructor (Brian?) was wonderful! Gave great explanations (how and WHY to do things) and paid attention while we were learning to climb (so you always knew he'd be there if you were at the top and the belayer needed assistance with lowering you, etc). Also, his corrections given were really great and didn't leave you feeling stupid or incompetent. Overall, he was really enthusiastic about climbing and it made the class and evening enjoyable. The gym itself was very open and clean looking. Putting it inside an old brewery was really cool, with the exposed brick and vaulted ceilings! The information in the class was really informative without including excessive info. I've climbed before, but it helped refresh how to belay and reminded me how to tie into the harness, etc.They have locker rooms and showers (with lockers that don't need your own lock). The equipment seemed well maintained and effective.Offer a wide selection of nutrition bars and drinks so you can grab something if you forgot to eat before or get hungry during. The community in the gym seemed really positive and friendly. Most of the time we were paying attention to the class, but the couple climbs we did after class were easy to find a place to climb. Price - the price of the class was very reasonable, and it's great that they refund it if you become a member. Things to consider - (These may appear to be negatives, but actually just require a little bit of extra planning and don't detract from the five star review at all!) Parking - street parking, but it's in a sort of designated area for the gym. Seems like it could be pretty tricky, so plan to have to search a little for parking, rather than just pulling into a lot.No A/C - I assume this is because of the beautiful vaulted ceilings and not wanting to obstruct the view of the exposed brick. They do, however, have a LOT of fans throughout the gym. It really only seems concerning when you first walk in, but you get used to the temperature. I didn't find that this was a hindrance at all. Just make sure you wear clothing to keep cool and drink water!! Overall, I look forward to attending the gym again to climb and would recommend it to anyone in the area looking to learn how to climb or who already know how to climb!
Love the climbs here; wish the workers were as friendly as LAB, though. All the workers come off like they don't really care and some really suck at making eye contact.

I had been waiting for a climbing gym to open up on this side of LA and it has been so awesome ever since they opened their doors. Peter and Kate, the owners, are so sweet and welcoming. The gym is clean and they update their routes regularly. The facility pretty much has everything you would need in a climbing gym and more! My boyfriend and I have a membership here and just love Stronghold!

This is no doubt a great facility in terms of the size of walls, varied routes, and other offerings like classes. The problem is the staff is generally not very welcoming, in particular the skinny white guy w the long dreads who seems to always be there. Some staff are pretty helpful but the vibe I get overall is not welcoming and I think new climbers often need a warm welcome because the scene here in LA is overall not friendly (I'm from east coast). If I was the owner I'd put my efforts into hiring people who are not just good climbers but also people who can help change the overall culture of the climbing scene at the gym. It starts w the staff.

It's pretty expensive for bouldering with a $20 day pass and $4 shoe rentals. However, the routes and problems are very beginner friendly and fun to figure out. There are multiple sections with varying degrees of difficulty and incline, with some cave problems as well. We got here at 10am on a Monday morning, and there were only two other climbers. When we left at noon, the number of climbers increased to about 10, but still not crowded at all. Overall, a great place for bouldering.

I love the stronghold climbing gym!!! As a weightlifter, I feel that this is the perfect place to test not only your strength, but your ability to apply that strength with your overall fluidity and nimbleness. Regardless if this place is busy or not, you will definitely have yourself a great time!

This is the best climbing gym that I have ever been to. The routes are constantly being update and I have yet to find a loose/spinning hold (although they do have a sheet to report them on). They also keep great data on the available routes and allow you to make comments regarding your perceived difficulty verses their rating. There are two auto belays as well as a dry erase board to advertise that you are looking for a belay partner, so you have options if you're there alone and would like to do a little more than just bouldering.

Wonderful re-use of old Brewery! The staff is super friendly and helpful! I recommend the core class with Chelsea. So far I can only do one class a week, my goal is to take the class twice a week! The climbs do change each month! Other climbers are super friend and finding a belay partner is easy, sign up on the white board between the changing rooms. Better yet, bring your friends!!! I was hooked the first time I went, which was April 6th, 2014!!!
I love this place! Great for beginners. My boyfriend brought me and is isn't think I could do it. Now we go almost every week. Great community feel and helpful staff.

I purchased a Groupon for a introduction to climbing class and toprope belay instruction and it was great. Staff was helpful, routes looked like so much fun and the gym was ver clean. I will be going back very soon.

Absolutely love this place!!!  I'm relatively new to climbing, but it's clear that Stronghold is the best!  The intro class was great, and informative about climbing history in general.  I was also impressed that the class was taught by the owner, who clearly has a passion for climbing - it's so inspiring!Climbing has been awesome - routes are good and it's never been too busy (though I do try to go on more off-times).  The small workout area is perfect to fit in some cardio, and I absolutely love Saturday yoga with Tessa!  I canceled my "regular" gym membership and never looked back!

For far to long Los Angeles was a desert to climbing gyms.   This place is awesome, It's clean, doesn't smell like feet, has many routes to climb, longer climbs and routes in all different levels.  The staff is super helpful, and the vibe chill.  If you have never climbed before and don't know how to belay, check out what time the intro classes are before you come.

Incredible experience with the three kids we brought today! Kudos to Peter and Katie who were incredible coaches and so patient! The kids learned a lot about self-esteem and confidence today...such a great time!

This is the best rock climbing gym in Los Angeles. The space is clean, there are a variety of different routes, and the staff is so helpful! I was blown away by how courteous they were. Melissa helped us sign in and answered all of our questions, and Matt B. went above and beyond to make sure we were safe and ready to climb. Awesome bouldering and top rope climbing. Also, prices are very fair and I can't wait to sign up for a membership. Thank you, Stronghold!
Great place I have never climbed and I end up seeing this place is just down the street from where I live so I checked it out and it was amazing I loved it and the price was perfect
SO MUCH FUNNNN Though I wish they would offer various and frequent classes

I went last night with my bf and some friends and woke up talking about this place and our experience. Not only did we get a hell of a work-out but the staff and environment far exceeded our expectations. After we had gotten a couple climbs in the owner of the gym actually came around to see how things were going and chat for a little bit...THAT's customer service. We can't wait to go back! This place is truly a gem!!!

Hot dog,Is there rock climbing in LA? If you thought the answer was "no. no. no." you were "wrong, wrong, wrong." This is the place to learn to belay, lead, and get your burn on. Man, am I glad it's there. Right next to a bar with 16 beers on tap for after... Whaddya want?

This place has so much going on. It's not just a climbing gym with your standard bouldering and climbing routes, but instead it's a climber's conditioning paradise. They have some of the most enjoyable walls I've climbed indoors as well as some pretty fun and challenging bouldering. It doesn't end there; they have an entire set of conditioning/training apparatuses available to strengthen hand/finger grip and upper body. When I saw this, I was like "damn, this is where I can finally attain kung fu grip status!", then I turned around and noticed that they have an entire rogue fitness power rack setup on the other side of the gym. Not only did I tear up my hands and work my arms from hours of climbing, but I got some ring work and squats in too! My body hated me the next morning, but it doesn't matter because now I know where to receive the best training/conditioning possible for surviving and navigating a post-zombie apocalypse world (zombies can't climb).

Let me start off with saying I love this place, the people are really nice and everything is well when I come here. However, unfortunately today while one of my friends was belaying a lead and gentlemen came up behind her and grabbed the rope without saying anything, I confronted him, he only said "what's up dude" not respecting a paying customer (me). His reason for doing this was because to him, she was belaying wrong. a couple of minutes later when we figure out that he accually worked there and was not some random dude grabbing the rope. He had all the right to do what he did if he told us before hand, the part that rubbed me the wrong way was his attitude. Mikey could have had a better attitude but he decided not to. This hurts me because I rep strong hold and tell most of my climbing friends to go and check it out, unfortunately now I have to mention this negative experience. We left soon after due to a ruin and awkward night. Sorry for the negativity but this really pissed me off.

Nice height on the routes and helpful staff.  As far as safety, they're a little loosie-goosie with what people are doing, but that's probably b/c they're new.  Overall, I'm a fan and will visit again when in the area.

Looking around for a new climbing gym to join and decided to check out their website. Noticed they were having a free showing of Reel Rock 9 tonight, thought it'd be a good time to check em out. Waiver process is fast and fluid, I brought all my own gear so I didn't need to check out anything. They make you become belay certified if you want to belay and lead certified if you want to lead, no problem. Matt was a great employee and led my belay certification and in a few minutes I was belaying my girlfriend and friend on other routes. Later I decided to do my lead certification, I've led many routes outdoors and am very comfortable sport climbing. I asked their employee Kate to help me, she was more than willing to help me out with any problem I had, and promptly looked for someone who could do the certification. She brought me Victor. Victor made me feel like he had better things to do and reminded me that they were closing soon and the fact that I wanted to do this now was unimportant to him. I led the route and came down. Victor said unfortunately he was going to have to fail me because my timing is bad and it was just a bad time for him, he told me he would pass me any other day but right now he just couldn't because he was busy. 1 minute later Victor is on a slack line taking photos, pretty busy huh Vic? I'll head else where to another gym, I gave this place an extra star due to the variety of climbs and Matt and Kate, they were very helpful.
Super fun. Clean, good rock features, spacious, bomber holds. I'm a member at Rockreation but I think I'll start thinking about a switch...

Stronghold is THE climbing gym! Why? The routes are higher, better set, its cleaner than any other gym in the area and the staff is superb. The entire gym is super clean, including the bathrooms, complete with lockers and showers.   Now for the key part for me......  the staff is very knowledgeable and very willing to help the newcomer and the folks that have been climbing awhile. I have gotten the cold shoulder at other gyms from staff including the owner of one of the local gyms. Not Here. Vic always greets me with a smile and he rocked my belay test giving me pointers that I didn't know and I've been climbing over 10 years. Great guy! The owners; Kate and Peter, are so helpful and super friendly too. They are very hands on with all the classes and everything that goes on in facility. Their passion for climbing and the sport is evident in the facility which is top notch. LA is lucky to have them.   When it comes to indoor climbing..... I won't climb any other place.

This place is hot, its not good for climbing and it smelled in there. They need to get Air conditioner in this location. Our group felt awful afterwards, you get exhausted a lot quicker because its warm inside.
This place is awesome!! I had a great experience.  There are lots of different options to climb.  I am new to climbing and felt there were all different levels of climbers.
Love this place! it's convenient and well maintained. There's always a vertical problem available for solving even during peak hours.
Tons of routes, friendly service, great atmosphere. Will def be back.

I had my son's birthday party here in early December and we had never been.  I'm always looking for unique ideas for my kids birthdays and this was a huge hit with 15 9-10 year old kids.  Great staff and the kids had a blast!  We kept running out of pizza so luckily there is one close by and I kept calling them and they delivered quickly for these hungry kids!  My son has been going to the kids class every Saturday from 3:30-5:30 and we think he's found his "thing".  He doesn't love soccer or baseball so this has been so great for our little monkey.  Kids can use the gym upstairs too during these 2 hours and there are instructors that work with them there too! Amazing!  You can leave your kids as they say on the Web site but I would not recommend it as the instructors don't keep that close of an eye on each kid.  Sometimes the classes are super full and while their waiting for a rope the kids will go and climb the boulders but are also free to be able to just walk out and nobody would notice.  I bring my work or read while I'm there.  I think that I'm going to start working out with one of the trainers while my son is climbing.  This way we both get in a workout!  Amazing location and beautiful building!!

The rock wall is gorgeous. Soooo much bigger and expansive than I had imagined. Very impressive climbs. The best part: the staff. So helpful, kind, and encouraging. Such a chill family vibe! Loved every minute of it!

Very nice gym.  Nice long routes.  Friendly staff.  The owner was very nice and approachable.  Was a more expensive than other gyms I have been to (we bought day passes).  I would recommend this place.

The gym facility is good, but they have terrible membership service. By terrible I mean they don't care about their members at all. It takes days for them to respond to an email (and you CAN'T get any service regarding your membership done at the front desk: only through emails) and they are definitely not flexible when it comes to pausing membership. If you have an emergency and can't use the gym, make sure to pause it at least 10 days ahead. I asked for an email 3 days before the first date of the month, was given the wrong email, waited for days, then emailed them again. By this point they charged my card. They don't even have the decency or courtesy to address my questions, just a template email. No explanation. Not even a "regretfully we can't due to etc reason." They recently raised their already very high price to 10% more, yet no more service is being offered. If there's another gym near me, I'd quit in a heartbeat.
